name: hydroponic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to or grown using a method of growing plants in water, sand, or gravel (= very small stones) to which liquid chemical plant foods are added, rather than growing them in earth: Green beans and cucumbers are suitable for hydroponic cultivation. Hydroponic farming requires less water and less land than traditional field farming. We use hydroponic tomatoes grown here in southern Arizona.
More examplesFewer examplesHe has developed plans for an easy-care hydroponic garden.There is a hydroponic greenhouse where fresh vegetables will grow all year round.When police searched his home they found cannabis plants and a hydroponic system.Our hydroponic lettuce stays fresher and maintains a wonderful flavour far longer than typical cut or harvested lettuce.Hydroponic technology - using nutrient-enriched water instead of soil - could be the solution. Contrary to popular belief, not all indoor growing operations are hydroponic.
